name: 'Time' On My Hands Online Trivia | Newspapers & Magazines | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was "Time" magazine's first Man of the Year in 1927?
questions.explanation:
Charles Lindbergh.

	Lindbergh won the title in honor of his historic solo flight across the Atlantic.

questions.text: In 1930 an Asian was named "Time" Man of the Year for the first time, who was it?
questions.explanation:
Mohandas K. Gandhi

	'The rest of Bombay's population has transferred its allegiance to one of the British government's too numerous prisioners, Mahatma Gandhi.' An excerpt from a British journalist's account of the jailing of Gandhi for his protests.

questions.text: The first "Time" Woman of the Year was Wallis Simpson, the woman who caused the abdication a British monarch. Which one?
questions.explanation:
Edward VIII.

	Edward abdicated the throne, and his brother George Duke of York became George VI.

questions.text: This person was named on three separate occasions on the "Time" man of the year - in 1932, 1934 and 1941. Who was it?
questions.explanation:
Franklin D. Roosevelt

	FDR was the only person to be honored three times in the first seventy years.

questions.text: In 1982 what became the first object to be given the title of "Time" Machine of the Year?
questions.explanation:
The computer.

	'The greatest influence, for good or evil, is not a man at all. It is a machine, the computer.' By Otto Friedrich, January 3rd, 1983.

questions.text: An entire generation won "Time" Persons of the Year in 1966. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
'25 and under'.

	There are several years in which large groups were given the title. 1966 was dedicated to the generation of 25 and under, as a result of the baby boom.

questions.text: Two Popes have been given the title of "Time" Man of the Year. One was Pope John Paul II in 1994. Who was the other one?
questions.explanation:
Pope John XXIII.

	Pope John XXIII was given the title in 1962.

questions.text: Who was the "Time" Man of the Year for 1979?
questions.explanation:
Ayatollah Khomeini.

	Margaret Thatcher has not been given the title. Jimmy Carter was 1976's Man of the Year and Ronald Reagan was 1980's Man of the Year.

questions.text: Bill Clinton and who else were joint winners of "Time" magazine's Man of the Year in 1998?
questions.explanation:
Ken Starr.

	Ken Starr's relentless pursuit of the President's relentless pursuits no doubt won him the honor.

questions.text: Environmental issues were upper most in the 1988 nomination for "Time" Person of the Year. What term won the title?
questions.explanation:
Endangered Earth.

	Concerns about the destruction of the rain forest and other environmental issues, led to this nomination.
